title: Forest-Stand-Generator-3D v 0.1.4 (Python Package)
description: Forest Stand Generator 3D is a Python-based scientific package designed to generate realistic three-dimensional forest stand scenes for ecological modeling, radiative transfer simulations, and forestry research. The package enables users to create physically plausible trees with configurable trunk, crown, and leaf properties, including crown shapes, leaf area index, and leaf angle distributions. Multiple trees can be arranged within a plot using uniform or random placement strategies while enforcing spatial constraints. The system provides interactive 3D and 2D visualizations using Plotly and supports data export to JSON and CSV formats, making it easy to integrate into reproducible scientific workflows.

title: CI/CD Enabled End-to-End Pipeline for Germany Weather Data Lake in MongoDB Atlas Using GitHub Actions and Python
description: This project implements an automated weather data collection and storage pipeline for over 100 cities across Germany. It retrieves live weather data from the OpenWeatherMap REST API every hour and stores it in a cloud-hosted MongoDB Atlas database with full GeoJSON support for geospatial data. All geographic information for the 100 cities and 16 federal states is stored as GeoJSON documents within the database. The system is fully automated using Python for data ingestion and processing, with GitHub Actions handling scheduled execution. In addition to real-time data, the pipeline maintains historical weather records, enabling use cases such as dashboards, REST or GraphQL API development, analytics, and weather forecasting projects.

title: AeroDesk LIVE: Real-Time Airport Arrivals & Departures Dashboard Using React.js, OpenLayers, and Aviation Edge API
technologies: Aviation Edge REST API (Flight Schedules/ Nearby)
description: AeroDesk LIVE is a real-time airport arrivals & departures dashboard providing live arrivals, departures, and weather insights for airports worldwide. Built with React.js, OpenLayers, and RESTful APIs, it integrates the Aviation Edge API for flight schedules and nearby airports, along with the OpenWeather API for live weather data. The dashboard includes interactive maps, dynamic charts, and searchable airport data, allowing users to visualize air traffic and explore airport details. Using tz-lookup and Luxon, it offers accurate local time conversions for tracking the longest and shortest flight routes.

title: CI/CD-Driven End-to-End ETL Pipeline for Germany Air Traffic Data Lake on Neon Cloud Database Using Python and GitHub Actions
description: This project implements an automated air traffic data collection and storage pipeline covering 84 airports across Germany. It retrieves live air traffic data from the Aviation Edge REST API every six hours and stores it in a cloud-hosted NeonDB (PostgreSQL) with full PostGIS support for geospatial data. All airport geographic information is centrally managed and stored within the database. The system is fully automated, using Python for data ingestion and transformation, with GitHub Actions handling scheduled execution. In addition to real-time ingestion, the pipeline maintains historical air traffic records, enabling use cases such as interactive dashboards, REST or GraphQL API development, and air traffic analytics.

title: Automated End-to-End ETL Workflow for EU Air Traffic Data Lake Creation Using FME
description: This project implements a fully automated end-to-end ETL pipeline using FME Desktop to build a real-time EU air traffic data lake. It combines flight arrival and departure data from the Aviation Edge REST API with detailed geo-spatial airport information from OpenAIP and OurAirports. The workflow extracts, transforms, and loads dynamic flight data into a scalable GeoJSON data lake, enabling timely analytics. Automation through Windows Task Scheduler ensures twice-daily updates, supporting comprehensive analysis of daily, monthly, seasonal, and annual aviation traffic in the EU via a generated dashboard and Python-based data analysis using GeoPandas.

title: HealthNearMe: Real-Time Healthcare Search App Using WebGIS, React.js, and Geoapify RESTful API
technologies: Geoapify REST API (Geocoding/ Places/ Address Autocomplete)
description: HealthNearMe is a web-based GIS application built with React.js and Leaflet.js that helps users quickly find nearby healthcare services. It integrates live geolocation and place data using the Geoapify REST API, including Autocomplete and Geocoding features for accurate location search. The app displays detailed place information with Leaflet marker clustering for dense areas. Users can apply multiple filters—such as category, distance, name, facilities, and opening hours—to refine results. The responsive UI is powered by React Bootstrap, ensuring a user-friendly experience across devices.

title: Responsive Personal Portfolio Website Built with React
description: This modern, fully responsive web portfolio showcases my projects, technical skills, blog posts, and professional background. It features smooth animations, interactive elements, and is optimized for high performance on both desktop and mobile devices. With a focus on clean UI/UX, accessibility, and intuitive navigation, it provides a seamless experience. All dynamic content is loaded from external JSON files, allowing frequent updates without the need to modify the React project itself.

title: VerticalGeoVis - Web Application Prototype (Master Thesis Project)
description: This project presents a web application prototype for visualizing the vertical context of the 10 most populated German cities. It integrates vertical attributes into a single interface using data from the DBpedia Live Sync API and UBA Air Data REST API (v3.0.0). Data is structured in 2D/3D arrays, stored as JSON, and visualized using D3.js Zoomable Circle Packing, Spiral-type Leaflet Markers, and a tabular view. User interactions and task completion times are tracked via LimeSurvey. Results are statistically analyzed using the bootES R package to evaluate the effectiveness of each visualization method for conveying vertical context of geographic locations.

title: GIS and Remote Sensing Approach to Urban Growth Monitoring in Cologne, Germany
description: This project analyzes land use and land cover (LULC) changes in the Cologne city region, Germany, from 2000 to 2022 using integrated remote sensing and GIS techniques. Multi-temporal Landsat 7 and Sentinel-2 satellite imagery are used to examine spatial and temporal land cover variations. Supervised classification in ERDAS Imagine generates LULC maps, while ArcGIS Pro supports spatial analysis and change detection. The study assesses changes in urban areas, agricultural land, forests, and water bodies. NDVI and NDWI indices are applied to evaluate vegetation health and water dynamics. Classification accuracy is validated using Kappa statistics, supporting informed urban planning and sustainable land management decisions.

title: nearPointR-R Package for Real-Time Location based services using Geoapify API with Leaflet
description: nearPointR is an R package offering real-time location-based services using the Geoapify REST API and Leaflet for interactive maps. It allows users to visualize their current location, explore nearby points of interest like restaurants, pharmacies and etc., download location data in CSV, GeoJSON, or KML formats, and navigate to the closest location via Google Maps. With customizable basemaps and categories, nearPointR provides an efficient, user-friendly tool for spatial analysis, data sharing, and navigation within R environments such as R Studio and R Markdown.

title: BlackJack-2Player (Player vs Computer) written in JavaScript
description: BlackJack-2Player is a browser-based game where the player competes against the computer in classic Blackjack. Developed with HTML5, JavaScript (ES5), CSS3, and Bootstrap 3.3, it features responsive design and smooth animations. Core logic uses arrays, objects, and classes. Built in Visual Studio Code, version-controlled with Git/GitHub, and deployed via GitHub Pages.

title: Data-Driven Insights on Natural Gas in the European Economic Area (1991-2020) Using ETL & Data Visualization
description: Built an end-to-end ETL pipeline and static visualizations to analyze natural gas consumption, production, exports, imports, reserves, and trends across EEA countries using FME, Python, and Jupyter. Leveraged Pandas, GeoPandas, Matplotlib, and Seaborn for efficient data processing and insightful geographic and temporal visualizations.

title: Spatial Database Design and Query Optimization using PostgreSQL, PostGIS and ArcGIS Pro
description: Modeled an ERD during the conceptual design stage, incorporating spatial attributes (POINT, LINESTRING, POLYGON). Built a spatial database using PostgreSQL and PostGIS, and utilized ArcGIS Pro for visualizing and assessing the impacts of highway blasting on nearby structures. Integrated spatial and non-spatial data, optimized queries for performance, and visualized results to support safety planning, regulatory compliance, and data-driven decision-making.
